headline.print_headline: If You've Got a Pulse, You're Sick
headline.main: If You've Got a Pulse, You're Sick

docs.lead_paragraph: For a nation that spends more than any other on health, the United States certainly doesn't seem very healthy.
docs.snippet: For a nation that spends more than any other on health, the United States certainly doesn't seem very healthy.

docs.lead_paragraph: At any hour of the day or night, someone somewhere is at the gym. One reporter decides to see what it was like to spend 24 hours at a gym.
docs.snippet: At any hour of the day or night, someone somewhere is at the gym. One reporter decides to see what it was like to spend 24 hours at a gym.

headline.print_headline: Unease on Industry's Role in Hypertension Debate
headline.main: Unease on Industry's Role in Hypertension Debate

docs.lead_paragraph: The American Society of Hypertension is in the midst of a dispute over the influence of drug industry money.
docs.snippet: The American Society of Hypertension is in the midst of a dispute over the influence of drug industry money.

headline.print_headline: Beyond 'I'm a Diabetic,' Little Common Ground
headline.main: Beyond 'I'm a Diabetic,' Little Common Ground

docs.lead_paragraph: Parents of children with Type 1 diabetes fear that their children's plight is being lost in the din of Type 2 diabetes.
docs.snippet: Parents of children with Type 1 diabetes fear that their children's plight is being lost in the din of Type 2 diabetes.

headline.print_headline: Rising Diabetes Threat Meets a Falling Budget
headline.main: Rising Diabetes Threat Meets a Falling Budget

docs.lead_paragraph: Spending has been cut despite the growth of a disease that figures in the deaths of 225,000 Americans each year.
docs.snippet: Spending has been cut despite the growth of a disease that figures in the deaths of 225,000 Americans each year.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Goes Organic: And Now for the Bad News

docs.abstract: At the risk of sounding more equivocal than any self-respecting blogger is expected to sound, I'm going to turn my attention from the benefits of Wal-Mart's decision to enter the organic food market to its costs. You'll have to decide for yourself whether the advantage of making organic food accessible to more Americans is outweighed [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: At the risk of sounding more equivocal than any self-respecting blogger is expected to sound, I'm going to turn my attention from the benefits of Wal-Mart's decision to enter the organic food market to its costs. You'll have to decide for yourself whether the advantage of making organic food accessible to more Americans is outweighed by the damage Wal-Mart may do to the practice and meaning of organic food production. The trade-offs are considerable.
docs.snippet: At the risk of sounding more equivocal than any self-respecting blogger is expected to sound, I'm going to turn my attention from the benefits of Wal-Mart's decision to enter the organic food market to its costs. You'll have to decide for yourself...
